Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2024/0296 b) Date of Occurrence: 17/03/2024
c) Installation Details: Skyhawk Fighter - AC-5400-125 at
Sector East Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Armament b) Date Component 26/03/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Countermeasure Dispenser d) Main Assembly: Station-4 Port
e) Nomenclature: Countermeasure Dispenser f) MOD Status: Modified
Assembly Unit
g) Part No.: AR-7205-Y9 h) Sl No.: SN-3499-180
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 29/12/2022 l) Date of Removal: 23/03/2024
Pg No: 76 Ln No: 17 Pg No: 131 Ln No: 23
m) Manufacturing Agency: Zenith Defense Tech n) Date, Month & Year March 2017
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2004 Hrs / 1634 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Safety Critical
b) Defect Observed: Arming circuit safety interlock fault. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Environmental exposure causing accelerated degradation of protective coatings
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Countermeasure Dispenser component.
Functional testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Update software to latest certified version with bug fixes
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Introduce protective coating to prevent environmental degradation
d) Attributable Code: NFF - No Failure Found
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 10/04/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Eng. T.R. Menon

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit.
Date: 13/04/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions.
Date: 12/04/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality oversight review completed. Recommend monitoring effectiveness of implemented preventive actions.
Date: 14/04/2024 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound.
Date: 17/04/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
